meanings.definition: To exceed in quoting or citing.
meanings.sent1: She always outquoted her classmates in history assignments.
meanings.sent2: The professor outquoted all other scholars in his research paper.
meanings.sent3: The student outquoted the teacher in a friendly quoting competition.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outquote others was like a shining beacon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: His talent for outquoting made him stand out in the academic world.

meanings.definition: To surpass in quoting or citing.
meanings.sent1: The author outquoted all others in the number of references used.
meanings.sent2: He outquoted his colleagues in the presentation with ease.
meanings.sent3: The librarian outquoted the book club members during trivia night.
meanings.sent4: Her words outquoted the silence in the room, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: Their dedication to outquoting each other was both impressive and amusing.

meanings.definition: To quote or cite more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He always tried to outquote his friends in conversations.
meanings.sent2: She outquoted her siblings in the number of book references made.
meanings.sent3: The team outquoted their opponents in the debate competition.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outquote others was like a river flowing with information.
meanings.sent5: Their goal was to outquote each other, creating a friendly rivalry.
